text: <@U379MC1E0> MVP is to be used with the view
This means that things as adapters do not have a MVP (Presenter) pattern (adapter is not a view)
So for instance in a pager you have some choices: you create a fragment to the pager and add the presenter to that fragment

The way i try to do MVP in Activity->recyclerView->viewHolders  is that the activity acts like the View, I make a presenter which supplies the view holder and adapter to Activity and presenter also forms a relation to the model data obviously
Or you use a custom view in the pager and add the presenter to that.view
<@U3DCPPVCP> how do you work with the adapter in the presenter?

What I meant to say is this: suppose your adapter requires some logic on adding items or something. Then I make an interface(lets call it AdapterLogicInterface in the adapter and implement that in the presenter. Now when adapter object is being made I supply that presenter object as interface object and thus the adapter logic ends up in the presenter.
<@U3697FDAN> Is it the right way?
There is no wrong way here
In the end its all about "is it testable?"
That being said, it's weird that your presenter knows about the adapter
Yeah well meaning to do Testing . I'm pretty noob here. Even in the internship they told me not to test so I have been waiting to learn doing Unit testing.

I would to continue this discussion at home

according to the convention

Fragment will control a View. Usually 1:1, 1 Activity/Fragment one MVC View

Retrofit2 "merges" paths

E.g: if your base url is `<https://google.com/accounts/>` and your endpoint is `login` then the result will be `<https://google.com/accounts/login>`. If your endpoint is `/login` then Retrofit2 will assume you want the root and it'll resolve to `<https://google.com/login>`.

hello I'm trying to follow an android material design tutorial but ended up stuck at crash. The crash would only be resolved if I specify in androidmanifest the theme instead of getting it from style.xml via `@style/AppTheme` which is supposed to get the value from either `values/styles.xml` or `values-v21/styles.xml`
<@U37BP6E73|arviio> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/arviio/F3ELEJWCW/lecture1.png|lecture1.png>
on which Api version are you running your app?

it will only be resolved if I specify `android:theme="@style/Theme.AppCompat.Light.NoActionBar"` in the manifest... I'm confused as I thought it should get the value from `AppTheme` which is defined in styles.xml
From what I understand
As your device has 5.0 the app tries to get its theme from styles-21.xml not from styles.xml
hence it gets a non- appcompat theme and thus the error
oh let me try that
hmmm not quite right, the right one was what I already did which is `values-v21/styles.xml`
